direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve sibling elements but from opposite ends of the sibling list.
Both methods retrieve sibling elements, with nextElementSibling() retrieving the next sibling in sequence.
Both methods retrieve sibling elements, with previousElementSibling() retrieving the previous sibling in sequence.
Both methods involve navigating through child elements, though child(int) retrieves by index rather than sibling relationship.
The parent() method is used to determine the parent element, which is a dependency for navigating sibling elements.
Both methods access and manipulate the list of child elements, though childElementsList() retrieves the entire list.
Both methods involve retrieving sibling elements, though siblingElements() retrieves all siblings.
